rComments: Professor Fu is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. I have taken every single one of her courses and have only good things to say. Her professionalism paired with her passion for contentious politics is admirable. She is also an amazing mentor with an open door whether you need to discuss class readings or future academic goals.

One of the worst lecturers I've ever come across. Half of every lecture is spent entertaining pointless discussion by students of which she jots their names down for 'participation'. She doesn't give you the opportunity to express any differing opinions other than her own -- which is heavily biased towards Chinese politics.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: It's clear she is very intelligent but a bit pretentious. The class was entirely based around a student presentation and class discussion, with few interventions by the professor. So if the presentation was poor, you didn't really learn anything. Few grades in the course and only one given prior to the end of the course with minimal feedback.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Prof. Fu is very engaging and enthusiastic about her work. She is very easy to talk to, and is available whenever you need help. You need to do readings in order to do well in the class. She's a fair maker, if you work hard, you will do well.
Not a fan. She didn't even want you to think, just repeat exactly what was in the book. Also her marking scheme for exams was weird.

Very stern and daunting person to interact with, half the lecture consists of her being spoken to by other students who you may or may not hear and so this may or may not be useful (usually not). Other half is exactly what you found in your reading, but don't expect to be able to get away with just learning the stuff - she has to know you learned.

By far the worst prof I had at this school. She spends half of a 2 hour lecture on useless "discussions" and records the names of people who decide to give their opinions. Halfway through the course and I still had no clue what the course is really about...

Course materials are interesting but she spends too much time on class discussions to the point that our time gets wasted. She spends 45min to an hour on class participation in which most of the time we just awkwardly stare at each other until someone decides to participate. Midterms are straightforward in essay form but she marks hard.
